resources:
VargGameSdk The object of the game is to fill all the rows and columns with the correct words. Each box can contain only 1 letter and words cannot extend beyond the number of boxes available. You can fill letters only, not numbers, spaces or symbols. Some boxes have smaller numbers on top, starting with 1 at the top left and increasing to the bottom right. These numbers are related to clues or questions about which word should go in the box. The number applies to the box it is in as well as the box to the right of or below it. Cross reference the number with the "Across" clue or the "Down" clue, respectively, to determine the answer to the boxes. The letters of words in rows can be used in words intersecting words in columns and vice versa. This can help you solve more words as you progress. Once you successfully fill all the rows and columns with the correct words, you win. //shabdjaal--------------------strings below----------------------------------------------------
The objective of this puzzle is to find and mark all the words hidden inside the box. Words can be placed horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Often a list of hidden words is provided. To make it more challenging, many puzzles have a theme to which all the hidden words are related such as food, animals, colors, celebrities or their movies. The simple strategy is to look for excellent letters within the word being searched for (if a word list is provided). Another strategy is to look for double letters in the word being searched (if a word list is provided) which proves helpful, as finding two identical letters side by side is easier than searching for two different letters. Finding is easy. If no word list is provided, one way to find words is to go row by line. First, all horizontal lines should be read both backwards and forwards, then vertically, and so on. Sometimes a riddle will help. The bigger the words and the more words, the easier it will be to identify them. In some computer-generated puzzles, if the person solving the puzzle sees one word, they only have to look at adjacent rows, columns, or diagonals to find more. The puzzle can use every row, column, or diagonal - or just use every other row, column, or diagonal.
Varg Paheli
